With a lightning reflex, Tucson catches Rodimus's punch, with his right han=
d, and balls a powerful fist around it.  He concentrates the energy from hi=
s all wheel drive systems into that one hand and uses it as a vise around R=
odimus's fist.  

" Trust me, I don't want to do this Rodimus.  I'm not get=
ting any enjoyment out of what I'm doing.  But if this is the only way to g=
et through to you, then so be it."

With his free hand, Tucson now concentr=
ates the all wheel drive power into his left arm, and manages to twist Rodi=
mus's arms behind him, holding him in a powerful grapple.  His hands clamp =
down painfully hard onto Rodimus's arms, and his grip remains as solid as a=
 powerful vise.  

" You fail to see that what Hydras, Scourge and Cyclonus=
 are doing, is merely using you as a pawn.  They've tampered with you and h=
ave no intentions of giving you power. All they want is the power you posse=
ss, and it appears they are succeeding in doing so.  I know you have it wit=
hin you to conquor this hold they have over you. You just have to want it b=
ad enough to do it.  The Rodimus I know would NEVER fall to such low standa=
rds.  THE RODIMUS I KNOW WOULD BE STRONG AND RESIST THE TEMPTATIONS THAT BE=
FALL HIM!  But I see you are not that Rodimus anymore.  You have become no =
better than MEGATRON!  IS THAT WHAT YOU WANT?!  TO HAVE A HISTORY THE SAME =
AS THE INFAMOUS DECEPTICON LEADER WHO WROTE HIS OWN DEMISE?!  TO HAVE EVERY=
ONE DESPISE YOU AND WANT NOTHING MORE THAN TO DESTROY YOU?!  IS THAT HOW YO=
U WISH TO BE REVERED?!  I WILL NOT LET THAT HAPPEN!  DO YOU HEAR ME, I WILL=
 NOT LET THAT HAPPEN!"

He finally rams Rodimus up against a wall with a po=
werful slam, and holds him there.

"BY THE NAME OF PRIMUS I WILL NOT LOSE M=
Y LEADER TO CORRUPTED FORCES!"

Determination mixed with rage.  It was what=
 Tucson was now feeling.  He had been subdued enough, and now he was itchin=
g to show his true colors.  Even though he had used a bit of brute strength=
 against Rodimus, he takes great care not to damage him gravely.

--- In nb=
wrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> >" I'm =
sure you wouldn't have wanted to do this either Optimus, and 
> >I can see =
why that sometimes the hardest lessons are learned when you face an 
> >ene=
my upon who has been your comrade for many years. But if this were you, I 
=
> >trust you would do the same."
> 
> For a moment, as Rodimus stood there =
before this somewhat smaller Autobot there was a brief moment of clarity, a=
 small instant of indecision. This Autobot showed a bravery and strength th=
at seemed oddly familiar to him. 
> 
> >" All right, have it your way Rodim=
us. This is going to hurt me 
> >more than it will hurt you." 
> 
> However=
 the moment passed as the dark Predacon shell programming that twisted his =
own kicked in. He smiled, as he cracked his knuckles, "You're right, this i=
s *will* hurt you more than it will hurt me." Rodimus replied in mocking to=
nes. 
> 
> With a quick motion he stepped foward to snap a quick punch towa=
rds Tuscon's head, ready to end this battle with this little upstart Autobo=
t - there was something about him that annoyed him!
> 
> In the meantime Cy=
clonus and Scourge had stepped back; watching the opening of the battle wit=
h looks of eagerness as they studied the moves of both combants.
